ReportSection.name: Instructions
ReportSection.If:
Deadline: May 10, 2024

Before completing the report:

  • Update the personal information on your Forum profile
  • Update your products*, including publications, awards, presentations, patents, etc.; be sure to assign each one to a GlycoNet project, if applicable (see “Managing Products” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add any new members (trainees and collaborators) who are not already in the Forum (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Edit the roles and relations of any trainees that you supervise (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add top research outcomes (found in the “Dashboard” tab on your project page)

To complete your section of the report:

  • Fill in all applicable sections of the Project Report:
    • Project Information
    • Summary/Background
    • Figures
    • Milestones (all)
    • Achievements
    • KPI
    • HQP
    • Budget
  • Generate and preview project report PDF
  • Submit project report to GlycoNet Administrative Centre

*Managing numerous publications can be challenging for investigators. Therefore, it is highly recommended that this task be delegated to trainees as much as possible.

Need further assistance?

Please visit the “Forum Help and FAQs” page on the GlycoNet website (http://canadianglycomics.ca/forum-help-and-faqs/), or contact the GlycoNet Administrative Office (info@glyconet.ca).

Deadline: April 15, 2023

Before completing the report:

  • Update the personal information on your Forum profile
  • Update your products*, including publications, awards, presentations, patents, etc.; be sure to assign each one to a GlycoNet project, if applicable (see “Managing Products” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add any new members (trainees and collaborators) who are not already in the Forum (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Edit the roles and relations of any trainees that you supervise (see “Managing People” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Add top research outcomes (found in the “Dashboard” tab on your profile page)

To complete your section of the report:

  • Fill in all applicable sections of the Project Report:
    • Project Information
    • Figures
    • Milestones (assigned milestones only)
    • Achievements
    • KPI
    • HQP
    • Budget

*Managing numerous publications can be challenging for investigators. Therefore, it is highly recommended that this task be delegated to trainees as much as possible.

Need further assistance?

Please visit the “Forum Help and FAQs” page on the GlycoNet website (http://canadianglycomics.ca/forum-help-and-faqs/), or contact the GlycoNet Administrative Office (info@glyconet.ca).

If.ReportItem:
Deadline: March 17, 2021

Before completing the report:

  • Update the personal information on your Forum profile, including gender, nationality, and alumni status if you will be leaving the Network in the near future (see “Getting Started with the GlycoNet Forum” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)
  • Update your products, including publications, awards, presentations, patents, etc.; be sure to assign each one to a GlycoNet project, if applicable (see “Managing Products” on the Forum Help & FAQs page)

To complete your section of the report:

  • Fill in the HQP section in the Project Report

Need further assistance?

Please visit the “Forum Help and FAQs” page on the GlycoNet website (http://canadianglycomics.ca/forum-help-and-faqs/), or contact the GlycoNet Administrative Office (info@glyconet.ca).

ReportSection.name: Report
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please ensure that all sections and questions in this report template are fully answered. If a particular section does not apply to your project, please indicate this by writing 'Not Applicable' or 'N/A' and provide a brief explanation as to why. Incomplete responses without adequate explanation may impact the assessment of your project’s progress.

Please note that this information will be provided to the GlycoNet Research Management Committee and Scientific Advisory Board for evaluation of performance. Your thorough and accurate reporting is important for maintaining transparency and ensuring continued support from GlycoNet.

Download the Report Template, and then upload a PDF below.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Milestones
ReportSection.title: Milestones
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item}
Edit Milestones
(Opens in a new Tab)

Comments

If any of the milestones have been delayed or abandoned, please comment on them below.
Please Note: If a new milestone is to be added, please provide a justification.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: KPI
ReportSection.title: Key Performance Indicators
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Publications

Please add all relevant publications, including the following:
  • Peer-reviewed journal articles
  • Other refereed contributions (e.g. papers in refereed conference proceedings, books)
  • Non-refereed contributions (e.g. papers in non-refereed conference proceedings, letters)
  • Other specialized publications (e.g. reports, briefings, online publications or other forms of grey literature)
To add the publication:
  1. Using DOI: Click the Add From DOI button. This is the easiest way to import publication details. After the information has been exported, please verify its correctness.
  2. Using CCV Upload: You can also upload an updated CCV if it includes publications related to the project. Please ensure that you only report publications that are directly associated with the project.
  3. Manually Adding Publications: If necessary, click the Add Product button to manually enter publication details.
{$item}

ReportSection.name: Budget
ReportSection.title: Budget Justification
ReportSection.Static:
Provide a written justification for any significant (>20%) deviation of any line item from the original budget in your approved proposal.

In addition, please ensure the HQP Contribution table provides the names, position, and salary details for all HQP working on this project.

If.ReportItem: {$item}

other funds

*For example, if a technician was devoting half of his/her salaried time to a GlycoNet project, and that time was paid for equally by NCE and external funds, then the "Paid from NCE funds" and "Paid from other funds" columns would each be 25%.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
In-Kind Contributions

{$item} *Add additional lines for different uses of funds from the same source

**Note: In addition to appearing in the tables above, a Statement of Accounts for each non-NCE cash contribution should be emailed to Cécile McNeil (ccile@ualberta.ca). This document will be prepared by the financial admin office at each institution and will be sent to investigators for review.**

ReportItem.title: What are eligible contributions?
ReportItem.text:
Partner contributions may include:
  1. Cash contributions
  2. In-kind contributions
    • Equipment & software
    • Materials
    • Logistical support of fieldwork
    • Provision of services
    • Use of company facilities
    • Salaries of scientific staff
    • Salaries of managerial and administrative staff
    • Project related travel
    • Other
Do not include:
  • grants from federal granting agencies, such as NSERC, CIHR, SSHRC, CFI or Genome Canada and its provincial centres for research, equipment, etc.;
  • contributions from partners who are funded by federal granting agencies, such as NCE, NSERC, CIHR, SSHRC, CFI or Genome Canada.
  • salaries of individuals who are eligible to receive funds directly from the granting agencies (e.g. faculty members of postsecondary institutions) and any associated administrative overhead costs.
  • contributions or contracts outside of the scope of the network’s activities.
  • time on committees and boards.

ReportSection.ReportItem: {$item}

Explanation

Provide a written explanation of any deviation between the actual contributions and anticipated expenditures and those proposed in the original approved proposal.

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: Partner Organization|Top-Most Executive Contact|Potential Role in GlycoNet's Legacy

ReportSection.ReportItem: Round 3 and 4 Collaborative Team Grants (e.g. projects ending June 2019 or December 2019) may apply for a project extension to March 31, 2020 by completing this section.

Objectives during the renewal period and justification based on progress to date

{$item}

Figures & Schemes PDF upload

{$item}

Milestones (from time of renewal to March 31, 2020)

Please download the following milestone template and upload it below.

{$item}

Budget (from time of renewal to March 31, 2020)

Please download the following budget template and upload it below.

{$item}

Budget Justification

{$item}

Expected matching

Projects are expected to leverage at minimum a 2:1 matching funds (i.e., for every $2 in GlycoNet funding, $1 in matching is expected; at least 50% of the total matching contribution must be cash.).

{$item}

Letter of Support (if available)*

Upload a single single ZIP file containing all letters of support.

{$item} *Letters of support are not required for the extension request, but should be in place before funding is released
